Keywords: Cosmic , Herald
Real Name: Morg
Special Powers
EXECUTION: Morg modifies attack +2 when attacking a single adjacent character with 2 action tokens.
WELL OF LIFE: POWER: If Morg occupies an opponent's starting area and hasn't been placed this turn, he can use Steal Energy, Blades/Claws/Fangs, and Probability Control for the rest of the game.
AXE SWIPE: Quake. When he uses it and hits, roll a d6 and deal damage equal to the result minus 1. (Minimum Damage 2).
Linked Units

Post Comment
Comments
June 29, 2021
fastcat99
Had fun playing this fig! It wasn't great or game breaking, but I love the idea of legacy cards. Him on a team of heralds works well. He's not the main target, and his specials are just icing if you can pull them off. I made it to the opponent's starting area in one game, smacked a low-point piece and activated the Well on the next turn. Then the timer went off. But hey, it was fun while it lasted.
April 28, 2021
pokolo
agreed his cost should have been lowered... what's the point of this card if he's still overcosted and therefore unplayable?? missed opportunity.
March 12, 2021
majio
Click 6 and 30 or 40 pts would be awesome
March 11, 2021
DatHomieSilverSurfer
if you don't make it to your opponents starting area in time, this guy isn't worth more than 85 pts in todays game due to his low values all around. They should have at least given him a point drop or a more consistent boost to attack and damage (Damage and Attack by + 1 for each token the opposing character has?) long dials were the one thing that older pieces had over newer pieces since stats will always rise, but now that new pieces are getting long dials AND big stats for way cheaper costs, these old beatsticks are garbage for the most part
February 23, 2021
spider_ham
Despite being overcosted by 15-25 points in comparison to 2021's Heralds of Galactus and other cosmic entities, Morg holds his own. Soft? Certainly, but the benefits of an updated design make him formidable with proper support.
